column5: Any advice on what to use or set ups.  I am going to be fishing North Tea Lake in ALgonquin shortly. I do believe there are smallies, lakers, and the odd splake.  Obviously, the lakers are deep now. suggestions would be greatly appreciated. thanks!

I haven't fished North Tea lake before but if it's a typical shield lake - like many of the other lakes along the highway - you can't go wrong using soft-plastics that imitate leeches and crayfish for the smallies (eg. black curly tail jigs and brownish-coloured tubes).  I have also done well using the standard Rapalas and twitching them on the surface in the early morning and at dusk.

You may want to snoop around the forum on this site.  http://www.algonquinadventures.com/   Manitou is good as well. White and black grubs alwasy a go to for me in APP for Bass.  Lakers you want to be deep this time of year 30 - 45 feet.  Good Luck and let us know how you do.
I'll second what Nemo said, although smoke is my goto colour in a grub. Can't miss with a light spinning outfit, some 1/4oz jigs and 3-4in grubs. Good luck!
